page.title: 09Local food-Oatcakes
page.content: Oatcakes originated in North Staffordshire at the beginning of the nineteenth century.They remain popular to the present day. Oatcakes are made from oats,flour and water and they are cooked on a flat,hot iron griddle.To this very day the recipe for Oatcakes remains a closely guarded secret.There are few if any shops outside North Staffordshire which sell Oatcakes. Oatcakes are usually eaten with fried bacon,grilled cheese and tomatoes.They can also be eaten hot with just butter.They remain essentially a breakfast meal but a number of people like to have Oatcakes for their evening meal.
